history.content:
I'm fairly sure the prerequisites aren't enforced (this is true for every CS class).

for CS186, I'd say CS61C is pretty ensential background. I'm sure people have taken it without it though, but 61C is a great course and there is no reason to take 186 first.

__________________________________________________

Prerequisites are not enforced for almost any CS class. However, CS 70 teaches you proof techniques and certain concepts which would definitely not be covered in Stat 140 (because cmon, CS 70 is not entirely a probability course), and I believe those skills are essential for success in CS 170. If you have such skills from some other class/are willing to self-study, you should be fine.

Above answer for 186 is not entirely accurate.

186 requires little to no knowledge of 61c concepts. Even though taking 61c first would only help you, it is definitely not mandatory. Many sophomores (including me) take the class as their first upper division CS course without having taken 61c.

I'm fairly sure the prerequisites aren't enforced (this is true for every CS class).

Can I petition to use PROB 140 instead of CS 70 for CS 170 prerequisite?

Also, is CS61C a hard requirement for CS 186? Can I just take the class without taking CS61C
history.subject: CS 170 Prerequisite
